I want to thank @mike_pence for joining us today, and I’m excited...
Representative gov't, the rule of law, and equal opportunity for all is protected here in the House -- by the people, and for the people.
Which is why it’s our responsibility, as the People’s Voice and representatives, to protect the Constitution and the balance of power.
But remember, Article I of our Constitution is where “We, the People” are protected from a government that “thinks it knows best.”
In fact, this is how government has come to operate: one person or one agency at the top deciding for everyone
...Or when they’re just trying to do the right thing, find a job and support their families.
...Or when they’re trying to get an appointment at the VA
...When they’re no longer able to afford the doctor they’ve seen for years.
Of course, that’s just one example -- people are dealing with these types of roadblocks every day...
...only to be met with a “CLOSED” sign because it’s taking the federal government more than two years to fix an elevator.
What an insult to families and school groups who travel here for a once in a lifetime trip to their nation’s capital…
Just steps from here, the Washington Monument is at a standstill because the gov't can’t get out of its own way to repair a single elevator.
This is a moment to think big, and reimagine everything from agencies to programs in Washington, D.C. function -- from top-to-bottom.
It's time to act with a sense of purpose to rebuild the American idea -- and reclaim the people’s voice.
As I think of the opportunities this year and new Congress bring, I’m reminded that this is a moment we’ve been given by the American people
Happy New Year, everyone! I’m so energized by this new, fresh start -- a blank slate.

There’s the mom with breast cancer, the grandparent losing memories to Alzheimer’s, the teen with a mental illness struggling in silence.
Max is just one face -- one name -- of the millions facing life with diseases that currently have no cure.
That’s why I’m so grateful for the leadership of Chairman Upton and Tim Murphy on 21st Century Cures.
But when the opportunity arises for a bold path forward, you seize it.
There’s uncertainty, and frustration.
Max’s story is personal to me. I know how it feels -- to be told that your child’s life isn’t going to go as you planned.
“We all deserve treatments and cures.”
He says, “I don’t think that will get 21st Century Cures very far. We need to smack down and take down the horrible diseases.”
Max says, “I don’t have that kind of money in my big blue piggy bank -- I only have about one hundred dollars…”
“There are over 7,000 rare diseases in the world...Treatments can take over 15-20 years -- and cost billions of dollars!”
When he heard about this, Max told his mom that he wanted to write something, too. Here’s some of his story, in his own words:

It’s not just a mantra. These eight simple words have protected countless American lives.
The United States does not negotiate with terrorists.
